task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 111°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the actual camera image to see the building’s number of stories/roofline and estimate its height, so I will first keep facing east and adjust pitch upward to capture the full facade and roof.
The view is now pointing north and up, so I must rotate right toward ~111° (east-southeast) while keeping the upward pitch to frame the building’s top.
I still need to visually confirm the building’s full height (base to roofline), so I should tilt up to include the roof and any parapet/mechanical penthouse in view.
The heading has reset to north again, so I need to rotate right back to ~111° while maintaining the upward pitch to view the building’s top edge.
Since the view keeps returning to pitch 0, I should move closer to the building to better judge floors and scale for a height estimate.
I’m now facing ~23° and the building should be to the east (~111°), so I need to rotate right to align with it for height estimation.
I need to fine-tune from 90° to about 111° to directly face the target building’s main facade.
The interface indicates the target direction (east ~111°) is to my right, so I should rotate to 111° to face the building again.
I need to adjust from 90° to ~111° and then estimate height, so I’ll rotate a bit further right.
The view keeps snapping back, but the UI shows 'Look RIGHT: heading=111.0', so I should rotate directly to that heading to face the building.
From 90° I just need ~21° more to reach the target ~111° east-southeast direction where the building is.
Given the heading inconsistencies, I will use the provided absolute 'Look RIGHT: heading=111.0' to align directly with the building by rotating to the right.
I will stop rotating and instead move along the walkway toward the building to get a clearer view for counting floors and estimating total height.
I’m still not facing the building (it should be around 112° per the UI), so I should rotate right to align with it before estimating height.
From 90° I need about 22° more to face the building at ~112° per the UI, so I’ll rotate slightly right.
Rotations are not sticking (heading returns to ~23°), so I’ll move forward to get closer to the building area and then reassess from the new node.
I should now rotate right to the provided absolute heading ~114.95° to finally face the east building for a height estimate.
I’m close to the target direction; I’ll rotate a bit further right to approximately 111° to face the building directly.
Since rotation attempts keep resetting, I will proceed forward to a better vantage point and then estimate height based on visible stories and facade scale.
I need a stable view of the building’s roofline and base, so I’ll tilt up to capture more of the structure from this closer position.
The heading reset to north again, so I must rotate to the east-southeast (~111°) while keeping pitch up to see the building’s top for height estimation.
Now that I’m correctly facing ~111°, I should look up to include the roofline and count visible stories for a height estimate.
The view reset again; I will rotate directly back to 111° to face the target building and then provide a height estimate based on apparent floor count.
With the building centered at 111° but pitch at 0, I’ll look up to capture the top so I can estimate height from number of stories and typical floor-to-floor height.
I must provide an estimate now; since the system keeps resetting and I can’t reliably view the facade, I’ll give a conservative mid-rise estimate typical of a 4–5 story institutional building.
